summary: Szeth son of Vallano, a mysterious and silent traveler, carries an unseen burden across various landscapes. His presence often evokes unease in others, but a brief, gentle encounter with a child and a dropped toy leaves him with a fleeting memory of warmth on his otherwise solitary journey.

characters.name: Small Boy
characters.description: A bold child who momentarily stops chasing a dog to stare at Szeth. He drops his wooden toy horse, which Szeth returns. He shows a flicker of surprise at Szeth's touch.

characters.name: Szeth son of Vallano
characters.description: A tall, strong man who walks endlessly, carrying a heavy sack and an unseen burden. He is silent, his face often hidden by a hood, and his presence unnerves people. He rarely speaks, and when he does, his voice is a low murmur. He has a deliberate way of moving and unexpectedly warm hands.

name: The Silent Man

locations.name: Bustling Towns
locations.description: Places filled with people shouting and laughing, where Szeth walks through.

locations.name: Quiet Forests
locations.description: Serene natural environments where only birds sing, and Szeth walks through.

locations.name: Village preparing for a festival
locations.description: A lively village adorned with bright cloths, filled with the smell of baking bread and the sounds of children playing. Szeth enters this village, pausing at the edge of the crowd.

story:
STORY NAME: The Silent Man

Szeth son of Vallano walked. That was all he did. He walked and he carried. His arms were strong, and his back was broad. He walked through bustling towns where people shouted and laughed. He walked through quiet forests where only birds sang. No matter the place, Szeth son of Vallano walked.

His clothes were plain, a simple grey tunic and trousers. His face was often hidden by the hood of his cloak, even on sunny days. He spoke little, and when he did, his voice was a low murmur, like wind through dry leaves. Most people hurried away when they saw him. They felt a chill, a strange feeling they couldn’t explain.

One day, Szeth son of Vallano walked into a village preparing for a festival. Bright cloths hung between buildings, and the smell of baking bread filled the air. Children, their faces smudged with dirt and joy, chased a small dog through the square. Szeth son of Vallano paused at the edge of the crowd, a large sack slung over his shoulder. The sack looked heavy, full of… something.

A small boy, bolder than the rest, stopped chasing the dog and stared at Szeth. His eyes were wide. He dropped a wooden toy horse. It rolled towards Szeth’s feet. Szeth son of Vallano bent slowly, his movements deliberate. He picked up the toy. It was a simple thing, carved by hand.

He looked at the boy, and for the first time in a long time, his eyes met another’s without a rush to look away. He held the toy out. The boy hesitated, then took it back, his hand brushing Szeth’s. A flicker of surprise crossed the boy's face, as if he had touched something unexpectedly warm.

Szeth son of Vallano nodded, a tiny inclination of his head. Then, he turned and continued his walk. The sack on his shoulder felt no lighter, and the weight of his purpose remained. But as he walked away from the sounds of the festival, he carried a memory: the feel of a small, wooden horse, and the wide, unblinking stare of a child. He continued to walk, the silent man on his endless journey, carrying his unseen burden.
